title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define project scope, goals, and requirements through stakeholder interviews and research on genomic data analysis techniques.

title: System Architecture Design
description: Design the overall system architecture for the BioInformaticsGenomeAnalyzer project. This includes creating components for data ingestion (utilizing Apache Kafka or Amazon S3), processing (Apache Spark and TensorFlow for different stages, with a preference for TensorFlow for machine learning tasks), analysis, visualization, and data management. Ensure scalability, performance, security, and maintainability aspects are considered. Provide a detailed breakdown of each component, their interactions, and suggest appropriate technologies for each part, considering the use of containerization (Docker) to facilitate deployment and scaling. Also, provide guidelines for testing (using PyTest) and documentation (using Sphinx). It is recommended to consider additional tools like Apache Airflow for scheduling and monitoring data pipelines, and GitLab or Jenkins for continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD). Furthermore, suggest techniques for handling large genomic data efficiently and optimizing ML models for better accuracy. Lastly, consider the use of BigQuery or Redshift for data warehousing to enable complex queries and real-time analytics. To ensure the RFC is ready for implementation, provide a detailed timeline and milestones. If necessary, break down the task into smaller subtasks and assign them accordingly. Update the rfc_state field to 'REVIEWED' once this updated task description has been reviewed.

title: Data Pipeline Design
description: Design the data pipeline for ingesting and processing genomic data from various sources.

title: Analysis Algorithm Development
description: Develop AI algorithms for analyzing genomic data and identifying potential genetic markers for diseases and drug responses.

title: Database Design and Implementation
description: Design and implement the database schema for storing genomic data and analysis results.

title: User Interface Design for BioInformaticsGenomeAnalyzer (Revised)
description: Revised design for a user-friendly, scalable, and accessible interface for visualizing and interacting with genomic data and analysis results. The revised design emphasizes ease of use, scalability, integration with the system architecture, adherence to accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1), responsiveness across various devices, real-time collaboration features, and compliance with security regulations. Suggested improvements include real-time data visualization, interactive data exploration tools, a clear and intuitive user flow, seamless collaboration through integration of chat or commenting functionalities, and implementation of security measures such as data encryption and secure authentication mechanisms. The design is ready for peer review once the assigned frontend developer has considered the suggestions. Update the rfc_state field to 'PEER_REVIEW' when the frontend developer provides feedback.

title: Security and Compliance
description: Implement security measures and ensure compliance with relevant regulations for handling sensitive genomic data.

title: Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Set up a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing, building, and deployment of the application.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop comprehensive test plans and perform thorough testing of the application, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests.

title: Documentation and User Training
description: Create comprehensive documentation and develop training materials for end-users and administrators.
